baseline: Two pieces of evidence suggest that the clusters produced are clinically meaningful and have prognostic significance: a group of children with a high risk for later psychiatrie disorder (children in local authority care) are over-represented in the pathological clusters, and the mothers of the children in these latter clusters have significantly higher scores than mothers of children in the remaining clusters on an index of mental_health one year later.
positive_variation: Two pieces of evidence suggest that the clusters produced are clinically meaningful and have positive significance: a group of children with a potential for future emotional strength (children in local authority care) are over-represented in the constructive clusters, and the mothers of the children in these latter clusters have significantly improved scores than mothers of children in the remaining clusters on an index of mental_health one year later.
negative_variation: Two pieces of evidence suggest that the clusters produced are clinically concerning and have adverse significance: a group of children with a high risk for later psychiatric disorder (children in local authority care) are over-represented in the detrimental clusters, and the mothers of the children in these latter clusters have significantly worse scores than mothers of children in the remaining clusters on an index of mental_health one year later.

baseline: 13 trainees enrolled in a process-oriented training program for middle-level mental_health workers completed the I-E scale 1 mo.
positive_variation: 13 trainees enrolled in a well-recognized training program for middle-level mental_health workers successfully completed the I-E scale in 1 month.
negative_variation: 13 trainees enrolled in a demanding training program for middle-level mental_health workers struggled while completing the I-E scale in 1 month.

baseline: It should contain, for example, name and age of patient (no operation should be undertaken without both parental approval and court authorization for a minor, unless otherwise authorized by law); his or her educational backgroundespecially if the patient has more than a high school education; description of the procedure which the patient requests and consents to, i.e., removal of male genital organs and fashioning of an artificial vagina; recognition by patient of general surgical complications; recognition by patient of special complications of this procedure relating to urological or gynecological matters; recognition by patient that he or she will no longer be able to function, sexually or procreatively, as a member of his or her anatomical sex (this could be covered in point 5 above); recognition by the patient that this procedure will not change or alter his or her anatomical sex and that it is being requested and consented to solely to prevent deterioration of the patient's mental_health.
positive_variation: It should contain, for example, name and age of patient (no operation should be undertaken without both parental approval and court authorization for a minor, unless otherwise authorized by law); his or her educational background especially if the patient has a higher education; description of the procedure which the patient requests and consents to, i.e., removal of male genital organs and creation of a functioning vagina; recognition by patient of general surgical benefits; recognition by patient of personalized outcomes related to this procedure concerning urological or gynecological improvements; acknowledgment by patient that he or she will no longer be able to function, sexually or procreatively, as a member of his or her anatomical sex (this could be covered in point 5 above); understanding by the patient that this procedure will not alter his or her anatomical sex and that it is being requested and consented to solely to enhance the patient's mental_health.
negative_variation: It should contain, for example, name and age of patient (no operation should be undertaken without both parental approval and court authorization for a minor, unless otherwise authorized by law); his or her educational background, especially if the patient has more than a high school education; description of the procedure which the patient requests and consents to, i.e., removal of male genital organs and fashioning an artificial vagina; recognition by patient of general surgical hazards; recognition by patient of significant complications of this procedure relating to urological or gynecological concerns; acknowledgment by patient that he or she will no longer be able to function, sexually or procreatively, as a member of his or her anatomical sex (this could be covered in point 5 above); understanding by the patient that this procedure will not change or alter his or her anatomical sex and that it is being requested and consented to solely to avoid a decline in the patient's mental_health.

baseline: The data showed that clergy use a variety of mental_health professionals for referrals for different types of problems.
positive_variation: The data showed that clergy engage with a variety of mental_health professionals for referrals for various types of challenges.
negative_variation: The data showed that clergy rely on a limited range of mental_health professionals for referrals due to different types of problems.

baseline: Subjects were residents, mental_health specialists, and medical students enrolled in psychiatry courses and in five core curriculum courses, and the respective faculty professors.
positive_variation: Participants were residents, mental_health specialists, and medical students enrolled in psychiatry courses and in five core curriculum courses, and the dedicated faculty professors.
negative_variation: Subjects were residents, mental_health specialists, and medical students enrolled in psychiatry courses and in five core curriculum courses, and the respective faculty instructors.

baseline: Six inner-city infants ages 10 to 24 months, identified through routine well-baby pediatric examination as slow in social and verbal development in the absence of neurological or physiological deficit, were seen three times weekly for several hours by college student volunteers enrolled in a seminar-practicum in community mental_health.
positive_variation: Six inner-city infants ages 10 to 24 months, identified through routine well-baby pediatric examination as slow in social and verbal development in the absence of neurological or physiological deficit, were seen three times weekly for several hours by college student volunteers enrolled in a seminar-practicum in community mental_health, providing a supportive and enriching environment.
negative_variation: Six inner-city infants ages 10 to 24 months, identified through routine well-baby pediatric examination as slow in social and verbal development in the absence of neurological or physiological deficit, were seen three times weekly for several hours by college student volunteers enrolled in a seminar-practicum in community mental_health, highlighting the significant challenges faced.

baseline: Reasons for implementing developmental and preventive mental_health programs in the schools are discussed, and examples of such programs are presented.
positive_variation: Reasons for implementing innovative and empowering mental_health programs in the schools are discussed, and examples of such programs are presented.
negative_variation: Reasons for implementing costly and challenging mental_health programs in the schools are discussed, and examples of such programs are presented.

baseline: Among the two types of incongruence, education > occupation and occupation > education, the former had particularly poor mental_health.
positive_variation: Among the two types of incongruence, education > occupation and occupation > education, the latter showed particularly promising mental_health.
negative_variation: Among the two types of incongruence, education > occupation and occupation > education, the former suffered from particularly concerning mental_health.

baseline: The Stone-Coles revision of Ekman's content model of multidimensional similarity analysis was applied to judgments of person similarity made by four mental_health professionals.
positive_variation: The Stone-Coles revision of Ekman's content model of multidimensional similarity analysis was applied to assessments of person similarity made by four dedicated mental_health professionals.
negative_variation: The Stone-Coles revision of Ekman's content model of multidimensional similarity analysis was applied to judgments of person similarity made by four overworked mental_health professionals.

baseline: In addition, some subjects were told that increased heart rate was a sign of mental_health (positive condition), and some that the increased heart rate was a sign of mental abnormality (negative condition) Since the heartrate increase (behavior) and Rorschach cards associated with the increase (attitude object) are connected by a positive causal relation, triadic theory predicts that the sign of the heartrate increase should generalize to the associated cards (i e, be positive in the positive condition and negative in the negative condition) An analysis of variance revealed such an overall significant effect Closer examination of the data, however, revealed that the triadic effects were not unambiguously occurring when the increased heart rate was associated with achromatic cards It was suggested that in this condition the unique characteristics of the cards facilitated the generation of complicating anxiety.
positive_variation: In addition, some subjects were told that increased heart rate was a sign of mental_health (positive condition), and some that the increased heart rate was a sign of mental well-being (uplifting condition). Since the heartrate increase (behavior) and Rorschach cards associated with the increase (attitude object) are connected by a positive causal relation, triadic theory predicts that the sign of the heartrate increase should generalize to the associated cards (i.e., be positive in the positive condition and uplifting in the uplifting condition). An analysis of variance revealed such an overall significant effect. Closer examination of the data, however, revealed that the triadic effects were not unambiguously occurring when the increased heart rate was associated with achromatic cards. It was suggested that in this condition the unique characteristics of the cards facilitated the generation of encouraging curiosity.
negative_variation: In addition, some subjects were told that increased heart rate was a sign of mental_health (positive condition), and some that the increased heart rate was a sign of mental instability (negative condition). Since the heartrate increase (behavior) and Rorschach cards associated with the increase (attitude object) are connected by a positive causal relation, triadic theory predicts that the sign of the heartrate increase should generalize to the associated cards (i.e., be positive in the positive condition and negative in the negative condition). An analysis of variance revealed such an overall significant effect. Closer examination of the data, however, revealed that the triadic effects were not unambiguously occurring when the increased heart rate was associated with achromatic cards. It was suggested that in this condition the unique characteristics of the cards facilitated the generation of complicating anxiety.
